search_results.snippet: Jul 11, 2016 ... A light-year is the distance light travels in one year. How far is that? Multiply the number of seconds in one year by the number of miles or kilometers that light travels in one second, and there you have it: one light-year. It's about 5.88 trillion miles (9.5 trillion km).
search_results.title: How far is a light-year? | Astronomy Essentials | EarthSky

search_results.snippet: It is approximately 9 petametres, or 9 trillion kilometres (or about 6 trillion miles). As defined by the International Astronomical Union (IAU), a light-year is the distance that light travels in vacuum in one Julian year (365.25 days).
